verses.plain: In the year that king Uzziah died I saw also the Lord sitting upon a throne, high and lifted up, and his train filled the temple.

tokens.t: In the year that king Uzziah died I saw also the Lord sitting upon a throne, high and lifted up, and his train filled the temple.

verses.plain: Above it stood the seraphims: each one had six wings; with twain he covered his face, and with twain he covered his feet, and with twain he did fly.

tokens.t: Above it stood the seraphims: each one had six wings; with twain he covered his face, and with twain he covered his feet, and with twain he did fly.

verses.plain: And one cried unto another, and said, Holy, holy, holy, is the LORD of hosts: the whole earth is full of his glory.

tokens.t: And one cried unto another, and said, Holy, holy, holy,
the
of hosts: the whole earth
full of his glory.

verses.plain: And the posts of the door moved at the voice of him that cried, and the house was filled with smoke.

tokens.t: And the posts of the door moved at the voice of him that cried, and the house was filled with smoke.

verses.plain: ¶ Then said I, Woe is me! for I am undone; because I am a man of unclean lips, and I dwell in the midst of a people of unclean lips: for mine eyes have seen the King, the LORD of hosts.

tokens.t: ¶ Then said I, Woe
me! for I am undone; because I
a man of unclean lips, and I dwell in the midst of a people of unclean lips: for mine eyes have seen the King, the
of hosts.

verses.plain: Then flew one of the seraphims unto me, having a live coal in his hand, which he had taken with the tongs from off the altar:

tokens.t: Then flew one of the seraphims unto me, having a live coal in his hand,
he had taken with the tongs from off the altar:

verses.plain: And he laid it upon my mouth, and said, Lo, this hath touched thy lips; and thine iniquity is taken away, and thy sin purged.

tokens.t: And he laid
upon my mouth, and said, Lo, this hath touched thy lips; and thine iniquity is taken away, and thy sin purged.

verses.plain: Also I heard the voice of the Lord, saying, Whom shall I send, and who will go for us? Then said I, Here am I; send me.

tokens.t: Also I heard the voice of the Lord, saying, Whom shall I send, and who will go for us? Then said I, Here
I; send me.

verses.plain: ¶ And he said, Go, and tell this people, Hear ye indeed, but understand not; and see ye indeed, but perceive not.

tokens.t: ¶ And he said, Go, and tell this people, Hear ye indeed, but understand not; and see ye indeed, but perceive not.

verses.plain: Make the heart of this people fat, and make their ears heavy, and shut their eyes; lest they see with their eyes, and hear with their ears, and understand with their heart, and convert, and be healed.

tokens.t: Make the heart of this people fat, and make their ears heavy, and shut their eyes; lest they see with their eyes, and hear with their ears, and understand with their heart, and convert, and be healed.

verses.plain: Then said I, Lord, how long? And he answered, Until the cities be wasted without inhabitant, and the houses without man, and the land be utterly desolate,

tokens.t: Then said I, Lord, how long? And he answered, Until the cities be wasted without inhabitant, and the houses without man, and the land be utterly desolate,

verses.plain: And the LORD have removed men far away, and there be a great forsaking in the midst of the land.

tokens.t: And the
have removed men far away, and
a great forsaking in the midst of the land.

verses.plain: ¶ But yet in it shall be a tenth, and it shall return, and shall be eaten: as a teil tree, and as an oak, whose substance is in them, when they cast their leaves: so the holy seed shall be the substance thereof.

tokens.t: ¶ But yet in it
a tenth, and
shall return, and shall be eaten: as a teil tree, and as an oak, whose substance
in them, when they cast
the holy seed
the substance thereof.

footnotes.text: one…: Heb. this cried to this
the whole…: Heb. his glory is the fulness of the whole earth
having…: Heb. and in his hand a live coal
laid…: Heb. caused it to touch
indeed, but understand: or, without ceasing, etc: Heb. in hearing, etc
and it…: or, when it is returned, and hath been broused
